citation: Arkansas Opioids Memorandum of Understanding (executed July 2021)
administering_body: Arkansas Opioid Recovery Partnership (ARORP) and parties to the MOU
effects: In July 2021, Governor Asa Hutchinson, Attorney General Leslie Rutledge, Association of Arkansas Counties Executive Director Chris Villines and Arkansas Municipal League Director Mark Hayes signed the Arkansas Opioids Memorandum of Understanding.  The MOU provides that the state, counties and cities will equally share Arkansas’s opioid settlement funds and directs that the money be used for evidence‑based strategies to abate the opioid epidemic【332936500398358†L144-L148】.  The MOU establishes funding allocations and joint administration through the Arkansas Opioid Recovery Partnership.
